file_content.text: The swamps of Quesh are teeming with unique and fascinating life-forms. I look forward to being able to study them.
The tanks are destroyed.
I destroyed the tanks. But some of the nearby creatures were exposed to the toxins, and I had to kill them.
I grieve for their loss, but putting them out of their suffering was a mercy.
It will take many moons for the Empire's venom-processing operations to recover. Hopefully by then, we will have driven them from Quesh.
Thank you for all you've done.
If the Imperial processing facilities are not destroyed, the environmental damage will be irreparable.
Well met, fellow Jedi. It reassures me to know there are others in our order who have taken an interest in this world.
Well met, noble Captain. Always an honor to meet one so dedicated to defending the Republic.
Well met, friend. Always an honor to meet those who have chosen to aid the Republic here on this world.
My name is Goonawaro. I wonder if I could be so bold as to ask of you a favor.
Jedi need to stick together.
Of course.
I would never turn my back on another member of the order.
Please, ask.
Always happy to help the Jedi out.
Fire away.
Your willingness is appreciated. I will get right to the point.
Is this the kind of favor that could get me killed?
"Favor" is pretty vague.
I will not mislead you. There is an element of danger.
Why do you need my help?
We Ithorians are not warriors. I came to study the impact of recent events on the unique ecosystem of Quesh.
If it isn't critical, I'm out.
What could be more important than preserving the ecosystem of an entire planet?
As you are no doubt aware, both the Republic and Imperials are extracting Quesh venom from beneath the planet's surface.
However, unlike the Republic, the Imperials are employing dangerous methods that are poisoning the world.
How terrible.
Their callous disregard for the natural order is an affront to all I believe in.
This whole planet is one giant, toxic swamp. How could it get any worse?
Quesh is already poisoned.
Quesh sustains life. Plants and creatures have adapted to survive in this environment. But the Imperials are disrupting the natural balance.
What are the Imperials doing that's so bad?
What kind of methods?
Instead of slowly siphoning Quesh venom from the ground, the Empire carves deep wounds in the earth and processes the reserves in great tanks.
The tanks release noxious clouds into the environment. Eventually, their operations will kill all natural life on Quesh.
How do we stop them?
I expect to get paid.
I did not expect a Jedi to be so obsessed with material wealth. But I will pay you if necessary.
I expect to get paid.
Oh. I see. Among my culture, such a brazenly mercenary attitude is rare. But I will pay you if necessary.
Use these explosives to destroy the tanks where the Imperials store their Quesh venom. This will cripple their production capabilities.
Be careful. Detonating the explosives may cause clouds of concentrated toxins to be expunged from the tanks. Avoiding exposure would be wise.
I don't care. [Refuse quest]
I understand. I appreciate your time, and I apologize for bothering you.
The Imperial factories are poisoning this world.
